name: places/ChIJq6p6X1JYwokRUdkjUlpjACg
formattedAddress: 400 W 43rd St #22p, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 400 W 43rd St #22p, New York, NY 10036, USA

originalText.text: Marcy's skill, sensitivity, creativity, and intelligence as a teacher and performer are bar-none. I have always felt safe as we progressed in my lessons, and permission to bring the fullness of who I am into the room. I am particularly grateful that I have been able to maintain consistent virtual lessons with her (for 4 years) despite the fact that I no longer live in New York City. As a singer and actor, I have never felt such a free and personal connection to my voice and music before working with Marcy. Not to mention the fact that I now know how to breathe when I sing, have a broader range, and a strong and healthy vocal instrument that is primed for any piece of music that comes my way.

text.text: Marcy's skill, sensitivity, creativity, and intelligence as a teacher and performer are bar-none. I have always felt safe as we progressed in my lessons, and permission to bring the fullness of who I am into the room. I am particularly grateful that I have been able to maintain consistent virtual lessons with her (for 4 years) despite the fact that I no longer live in New York City. As a singer and actor, I have never felt such a free and personal connection to my voice and music before working with Marcy. Not to mention the fact that I now know how to breathe when I sing, have a broader range, and a strong and healthy vocal instrument that is primed for any piece of music that comes my way.

originalText.text: Marcy helped me deal with my anxiety and nervousness that was getting in the way of my public speaking. My new position at work requires me to travel and deliver talks to large numbers of colleagues. Marcy gave me warm up exercises for my speaking voice so that I don’t get hoarse. She taught me how to project my energy, with acting techniques that have helped me stay on point with my content while connecting with my listeners. I am not winging it. I really know what I am doing now. I feel authentically me.  The feedback has been very rewarding.

text.text: Marcy helped me deal with my anxiety and nervousness that was getting in the way of my public speaking. My new position at work requires me to travel and deliver talks to large numbers of colleagues. Marcy gave me warm up exercises for my speaking voice so that I don’t get hoarse. She taught me how to project my energy, with acting techniques that have helped me stay on point with my content while connecting with my listeners. I am not winging it. I really know what I am doing now. I feel authentically me.  The feedback has been very rewarding.

originalText.text: I was able to increase my vocal range easily. I was surprised that I could sing high notes so effortlessly. Not only that, but my lower range became stronger and more resonant.  I no longer have a sore throat after I sing. For the first time, I really understand how to breathe and connect my breath to my vocal tone. Amazing. The lessons are fun. Marcy is so knowledgable and at the same time not intimidating. I have done a lot of singing in my life and even though I needed to  make some changes to my habits, I felt that I was respected in the process.

text.text: I was able to increase my vocal range easily. I was surprised that I could sing high notes so effortlessly. Not only that, but my lower range became stronger and more resonant.  I no longer have a sore throat after I sing. For the first time, I really understand how to breathe and connect my breath to my vocal tone. Amazing. The lessons are fun. Marcy is so knowledgable and at the same time not intimidating. I have done a lot of singing in my life and even though I needed to  make some changes to my habits, I felt that I was respected in the process.

originalText.text: Marcy has been my voice coach for over 20 years, and has helped me accomplish goals with my singing that I couldn’t imagine otherwise.  She has an extraordinary ability to develop a shared real-time awareness with the student of his or her vocal mechanics down to the smallest detail.  And she combines technique with exuberance and moral support - she is truly a master teacher and incredible resource!

She has an extraordinary ability to develop a shared real-time awareness with the student of his or her vocal mechanics down to the smallest detail.  And she combines technique with exuberance and moral support - she is truly a master teacher and incredible resource!

originalText.text: I have always wanted to sing, but I was terrified. Marcy has made me feel so comfortable in the lesson. She talks about “exploring, without judgment”. I can’t believe how much fun I am having…and I am improving.
